Using the Teachers Learning Center (TLC)

The Teachers Learning Center (TLC) is located on the 3rd floor West wing of the David O. McKay Library.

The TLC consists of 3 areas:

  • Juvenile Collection: Our collection of juvenile books covers preschool through high school. Emphasis is placed on classics and materials currently used in schools, with particular attention to Newbery and Caldecott Honor and Medal books, as well as other titles receiving awards and positive reviews. Our primary audience is teachers in training in elementary and secondary education and extends to the general student body who may use the materials for recreational reading and class presentations.
  • Signature Collection: Materials from the Signature Collection may be checked out from the library. This collection includes large books, readers, manipulatives and other teaching media. To check out an item, complete the form in the Signature Collection binder located on the stand near the collection materials.
  • Curriculum Collection: The McKay Library is an official repository for K-12 curriculum materials adopted by the state of Idaho. Textbooks and other materials in this collection are not available for checkout, but students and other patrons are welcome to use these materials within the library.
    The Curriculum Collection materials are arranged:
      A.  Alphabetically by curriculum subject (Health, Humanities, Language Arts, Math, Science, Social Studies, and Technology).

    B. Within each subject, textbooks are divided between elementary, middle and secondary.
    C. Within each division, alphabetically by publisher.
    D. Within each publisher's series, textbooks are arranged by grade level.

Smaller subject areas can be found arranged alphabetically within some of the larger curriculum areas.
